place.name: LLANGYNOG
place.gazetteerText: LLANGYNOG, a parish in Builth district, Brecon; under Mynydd-Epynt mountains, 3½ miles S by E of Builth r. station. Post town, Builth, Breconshire. Acres, 1,429. Real property, £363. Pop., 51. Houses, 11. The surface is hilly. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of St. David's. Value, £69. Patron, the Bishop of St. David's. The church is dedicated to St. Cynog. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
